text: Sergei Nikitich Khrushchev (, July 2, 1935 - June 18, 2020) was a Russian- American engineer. He was the son of former Soviet Premier Nikita Khrushchev. Khrushchev worked in many high-level engineering positions. From 1968 to 1991, he worked at the Control Computer Institute in Moscow. From the years 1958 to 1968, Khrushchev worked as an engineer, then later as a deputy section head in charge of guidance systems for missile and space design. He was an advisor to the Cold War Museum. He was a Senior Fellow at the Watson Institute for International and Public Affairs at Brown University. In July 1999, he became a naturalized American citizen.
